item.title: Shonell add a quote by Robert Cormier
item.description: "The beautiful part of writing is that you don't have to get it right the first time, unlike, say, a brain surgeon." -- Robert Cormier

item.title: Shonell add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "A woman must have money and a room of her own if she is to write fiction." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Shonell add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Shonell add a quote by Charlotte Perkins Gilman
item.description: "The first duty of a human being is to assume the right relationship to society -- more briefly, to find your real job, and do it." -- Charlotte Perkins Gilman

item.title: Shonell add a quote by Charlotte Perkins Gilman
item.description: "Death? Why all this fuss about death? Use your imagination, try to visualize a world without death! Death is the essential condition to life, not an evil." -- Charlotte Perkins Gilman

item.title: Shonell add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "Put your ear down close to your soul and listen hard." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Shonell add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "The joy that isn't shared dies young." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Shonell add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "The beautiful feeling after writing a poem is on the whole better even than after sex, and that's saying a lot." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Shonell add a quote by Sara Teasdale
item.description: "I make the most of all that comes and the least of all that goes." -- Sara Teasdale

item.title: Shonell add a quote by Sara Teasdale
item.description: "Life is but thought." -- Sara Teasdale

item.title: Shonell add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "And by the way, everything in life is writable about if you have the outgoing guts to do it, and the imagination to improvise. The worst enemy to creativity is self-doubt." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Shonell add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Dying is an art. Like everything else, I do it exceptionally well. I do it so it feels like hell. I do it so it feels real. I guess you could say I have a call." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Shonell add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead; I lift my eyes and all is born again." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Shonell add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Nothing stinks like a pile of unpublished writing." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Shonell add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "Everything I've ever done, in the writing world, has been to expand articulation, rather than to close it." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Shonell add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "I think some aspects of writing can be taught. Obviously, you can't teach vision or talent. But you can help with comfort." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Shonell add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "I'm not entangled in shaping my work according to other people's views of how I should have done it." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Shonell add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "We die. That may be the meaning of life. But we do language. That may be the measure of our lives." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Shonell add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "Oh, please don't go—we'll eat you up—we love you so!" -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Shonell add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "There must be more to life than having everything!" -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Shonell add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "I cry a lot because I miss people. They die and I can't stop them. They leave me and I love them more." -- Maurice Sendak
